intro: Artemisia gmelinii var. gmelinii, commonly known as silver sagebrush, is a perennial shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring silvery-gray foliage with aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flower heads that are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. It is well adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Its essential oils contribute to its strong, distinctive aroma and have been used in traditional medicine.
